name: Titanium.UI.iOS.Toolbar
summary: An iOS toolbar, which can contain buttons and certain other controls.

properties.name: barColor
properties.summary: Background color for the toolbar, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description:
To use a background image on the toolbar, either barColor must be a fully or partially transparent color, or the translucent property must be true.

To use a background gradient on a toolbar, barColor must be 'transparent' and the the translucent property must be true.

For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: extendBackground
properties.summary: If true, the background of the toolbar extends upwards.
properties.description: This property allows the user to specify that the toolbar's background show through the status bar. This property is only intended to be used with toolbars hosted in windows with no navigation controllers. The toolbar must be placed at the top of the screen just below the status bar for this property to work as expected. This must be specified at creation.
properties.default: Undefined. Behaves as if set to false.

properties.name: items
properties.summary: An array of buttons (or other widgets) contained in the toolbar.

properties.name: translucent
properties.summary: If true, a translucent background color is used for the toolbar.
properties.description: Note that if translucent is false, views under the toolbar are hidden, even if barColor is set to a semi-transparent or transparent color.
